result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 13CF381 & 14CF69 - Defendant Aaron R. Schreiber in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea today; sentencing at later date. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. Defendant enters NC by Alford Plea to 13CF381 Cts 1, 4, 7, 10, 11, 24, 25, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34 & 35. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty on said charges; remaining charges in this case & 14CF69 are DRI. Cases as discussed from Green Lake, Fond du Lac and Walworth Counties - those cases to be DRI in their respective counties. NGI plea is formally withdrawn. Court accepts. Discussion on scheduling. Court schedules sentencing.
Plea hearing on May 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Parties heard on def's mtn to dismiss; Court heard and mtn to dismiss is denied; discussion held on scheduling;  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Motion hearing on March 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Aaron R. Schreiber in court with attorney William A Mayer.  Kurt F Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.

9:06 - Defendant Aaron R. Schreiber in court, in custody with attorney Catherine Terry for attorney William A Mayer.  Yolanda J Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Address change to DCJ. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond  without specific conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
